Class Creature

java.lang.Object
  Creature

public abstract class Creature
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class Creature - The creature is the main class from which all other battling creatures derive. It is the creature's job to maintain current health values in response to requests to takeDamage. It also must report if the creature is alive or dead. The creature is also responsible for calculating damage delivered based on the creature's strength (1 to str)

Constructor Detail

default constructor - this should never actually run

Creature

public Creature(int str,
                int hp)
Create a creature with a given strength and hit point level. Store max hitpoints to allow for healing to be implemented later Heals must never allow for more hit points than the creature started with

Parameters:
str - the strength of the creature, used to calculate damage
hp - the health of the creature at the start of the simulation, and the current health levels during battle
Method Detail

damage

public int damage()
Allows a creature to determine how much damage it is causing in this round of battle

Returns:
a value between 1 and str to be used to cause damage to another creature

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
Is this creature still capable of fighting?

Returns:
true when current hit point level is greater than zero

isDead

public boolean isDead()
Is this creature deceased?

Returns:
true when current hit point level is less than or equal to zero

takeDamage

public void takeDamage(int damage)
takeDamage receives a value for the amount of damage to subtract from the current total of hit points

Parameters:
damage - value to remove from hit point count
